title: 109_s3526
content: The Act may be cited as the "Indian Land Consolidation Act Amendments of 2006". It includes definitions for various terms. The Indian Land Consolidation Act (25 U.S.C. 2201) is amended to redefine the term "land" to include any real property and for intestate succession purposes only. The Indian Land Consolidation Act is amended to include improvements on trust or restricted lands owned by a decedent before their death. SEC. 3. DESCENT AND DISTRIBUTION. Section 207 of the Indian Land Consolidation Act is amended to update certain clauses and dates. The Indian Land Consolidation Act's Section 207 is amended to update clauses and dates related to purchase requests and consent requirements for eligible purchasers. The Indian Land Consolidation Act's Section 207 is amended to update clauses and dates related to purchase requests and consent requirements for eligible purchasers. The Secretary shall sell the interest to the eligible purchaser selected by the applicable heir, devisee, or surviving spouse. Amendments include adding and removing clauses in paragraphs (4) and (5) for clarity. The Indian Land Consolidation Act's Section 207 is amended to update clauses and dates related to purchase requests and consent requirements for eligible purchasers. Amendments include changing "auction" to "sale" and clarifying the representation of the decedent's interest in the land at the time of death. The Indian Land Consolidation Act's Section 207 is amended to update purchase requests and consent requirements for eligible purchasers. Amendments include clarifying the process for purchasing interests from non-member heirs. The Indian Land Consolidation Act's Section 207 is amended to update purchase requests and consent requirements for eligible purchasers, including exceptions for certain interests in the estate of a decedent who dies before July 20, 2007. The Indian Land Consolidation Act's Section 207 is amended to update purchase requests and consent requirements for eligible purchasers, including exceptions for certain interests in the estate of a decedent who dies on or before July 20, 2007. The Secretary may extend the period of nonapplicability for up to 1 year if a notice of extension is published in the Federal Register by July 2, 2007. The Indian Land Consolidation Act's Section 207 was passed by the Senate on September 30, 2006.
